metadata.title: CVE-2022-45403 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Service Workers should not be able to infer information about opaquecross-origin responses; but timing information for cross-origin mediacombined with Range requests might have allowed them to determine thepresence or length of a media file. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR< 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45403` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
